page.title: 17Wildlife around Himbleton
page.content: Lilly of the Valley and Orchids are still to be found in Goosehill Woods. Many rare butterflies breed in the area. The most notable place for these being Trench Wood, where nightingales are often heard singing during the summer months. The area has a considerable number of footpaths, many of which are obstructed but a conserted effort to clear at least some of the major paths is now being made under a scheme known as the Higherarchy Scheme. The main footpath is the Wychavon Way which passes through the area on its route from Holt Fleet to Winchcombe. This footpath is 42 miles long.
